page.title: 01BO'NESS & SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: This block covers the southern part of Bo'ness and farm land to the south of the town. Bo'ness is short for Borrowstounness. It is a small town that grew up on the land sticking out into the River Forth. There are several housing estates in this area. The Robertson Estate is a private housing estate . These houses were built in 1980. The Mingle and Grahamsdyke are council estates which were built in the 1960's and '70s. There is a Recreation centre which has dry and wet sports facilities. Muirhouses, or the Murrays, as local people call it is a small village which is now part of Bo'ness. It has a small council housing estate, some old private houses, some modern bungalows and one general shop.
